Heart failure

Heart failure

Life is prolonged by Î²-blockers, ACE-inhibitors and spironolactone.

Acute decompensation is managed by:

Correction of hypoxia - CPAP, IPPV

Optimising preload - diuretics, nitrates

Maintaining cardiac output (CI>2) - inotropes, resynchronisation or revascularisation

[Valchanov, K. et al. Contin Educ Anaesth Crit Care Pain 8 , 167-171(2008).]
